intro: Argostemma epitrichum, commonly known as the hairy argostemma, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Small, white to pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months.
